author: akarasulu
msg: don't know what this is for

author: felicity
msg: bug 3053: the strip2.t test was severely broken.  the output redirection would fail, so it would end up comparing a blank file to a blank file, which of course always works ...

author: felicity
msg: if a complete blank message is passed to parse(), pristine_headers would be undef which causes lots of error checking to have to go in...  just default it to ''.  also, _parse_body() was doing a CRLF->LF conversion on the whole message body, and then again for each multipart part, which is a waste since we did it all the first time.  got rid of that.

author: felicity
msg: get rid of MsgContainer::ignore() which nothing calls ...   this also lets us get rid of the noexit setting code which is only used in ignore...

author: felicity
msg: bug 1971: 'spamassassin -d -t' used to only remove the markup of the input mail, but will now remove the markup and run through -t as usual.  also got rid of the calls to MsgContainer->ignore() from spamassassin and replaced with a simple exit() command.  also found that -d wasn't working correctly due to the new API so that's fixed. :)
